entry.title: Manage your cookbooks with librarian-chef
entry.content:
librarian-chef is like a bundler for cookbooks. Manage your cookbooks and dependencies in a single file.

Here is how

$ gem install librarian-chef
$ librarian-chef init</p>

<h1>edit the newly created Cheffile to add your cookbooks</h1>

<p>$ librarian-chef install

Cookboks listed in the Cheffile will be downloaded to the cookbooks folder, you will also noticed a Cheffile.lock is created locking the versions.

Here is an example:

</p>

<h1>!/usr/bin/env ruby</h1>

<h1>^syntax detection</h1>

<p>site ‘<a href="http://community.opscode.com/api/v1">http://community.opscode.com/api/v1</a>’
cookbook ‘apt’
cookbook ‘git’
cookbook ‘build-essential’
cookbook ‘tmux’</p>

<h1>Include cookbooks from github</h1>

<p>cookbook ‘ruby_build’,</p>

<pre><code>      :git => 'https://github.com/fnichol/chef-ruby_build.git'
</code></pre>

<p>cookbook ‘rbenv’,</p>

<pre><code>      :git => 'https://github.com/fnichol/chef-rbenv.git',
      :ref => 'v0.7.2'
</code></pre>
